alert.note: Alert for Weston (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 9:18PM MDT until June 23 at 2:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Wyoming, including the following county, Weston. * WHEN...Until 330 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 918 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dairy Draw, Sweetwater Creek, Red Creek, Salt Creek, Whoopup Creek, Little Oil Creek, Stockade Beaver Creek, Rats Valley Creek, Little Bear Run, Bear Run and Oil Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Four Corners.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
